qas.question: What effect does jet-lag and shift-work have on the human body?
Animals that eat during resting periods show what body increase?
How does irregular eating during shift-work effect insulin?
Besides insulin sensitivity, what other effect does shift-work have on the body?
What type of work can lead to heart, hypertension and inflammation?

plausible_answers.text: circadian and metabolic events in the body

qas.question: What does shift work have little effect on?

plausible_answers.text: forced to eat during their resting period

qas.question: What causes animals to have decreased body mass?

plausible_answers.text: shift-work that favors irregular eating times

qas.question: What kind of work leads to lower body mass?

context: Shift-work or chronic jet-lag have <a0_0>profound consequences<a0_0/> on <b5_0>circadian and metabolic events in the body<b5_0/>. Animals that are <b6_0>forced to eat during their resting period<b6_0/> show increased <a1_0>body mass<a1_0/> and altered expression of clock and metabolic genes.[medical citation needed] In humans, <b7_0>shift-work that favors irregular eating times<b7_0/> is associated with altered <a2_0>insulin sensitivity<a2_0/> and <a3_0>higher body mass<a3_0/>. <a4_0><b8_0>Shift-work<b8_0/><a4_0/> also leads to increased metabolic risks for cardio-metabolic syndrome, hypertension, inflammation.
